references.paper_title: Truthful allocation mechanisms without payments: Characterization and implications on fairness
references.reason: This paper provides a crucial characterization of truthful mechanisms for fair allocation with two agents, establishing a lower bound that motivates the use of predictions in this paper.

references.paper_title: On truthful mechanisms for maximin share allocations
references.reason: This paper studies truthful mechanisms for approximating the maximin share value, providing a benchmark against which the proposed learning-augmented mechanisms are compared.

references.paper_title: Fair enough: Guaranteeing approximate maximin shares
references.reason: This paper introduces the maximin share concept and explores approximation algorithms for fair allocation which is the main focus of this paper.

references.paper_title: The combinatorial assignment problem: Approximate competitive equilibrium from equal incomes
references.reason: This foundational paper introduces the maximin share concept and motivates the study of fair allocations with indivisible goods which is the context of this paper.

references.paper_title: Learning-augmented mechanism design: Leveraging predictions for facility location
references.reason: This paper introduces the learning-augmented framework, which provides the theoretical foundation for the approach used in this paper.
